references.paper_title: Overcoming catastrophic forgetting in neural networks
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the continual learning field, introducing the catastrophic forgetting problem and proposing a solution that heavily influences many subsequent works, including this one.

references.paper_title: Gradient episodic memory for continuum learning
references.reason: This paper is highly influential in the continual learning domain due to the proposal of gradient episodic memory, a prominent experience replay method that is frequently benchmarked against.

This paper introduces A-GEM, a significant advancement in rehearsal-based methods, improving the efficiency of experience replay and influencing the design of subsequent continual learning strategies.

references.paper_title: Semi-supervised classification with graph convolutional networks
references.reason: This foundational paper introduces graph convolutional networks (GCNs), a crucial architecture used extensively in graph-related machine learning tasks, including continual graph learning, which this paper focuses on.

references.paper_title: Sparsified subgraph memory for continual graph representation learning
references.reason: This paper directly addresses continual graph learning, proposing a method that is closely related to the approach presented in this paper, making it an important comparative work.
